alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 12:25PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern St. Bernard, southern Orleans and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 100 PM CDT... At 1225 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Poydras, or 9 miles southeast of Belle Chasse. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Belle Chasse, Violet and Poydras. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
